title: 15 absurd moments from Donald Trump's jaw-dropping press conference
text:

Donald Trump reportedly walked into the Oval Office this morning, and told aides: "Let's hold a press conference today." 
What followed was a rambling, incoherent appearance some commentators compared to speeches made by unhinged Libyan dictator Colonel Gaddafi. 
The President complained the press don't tell the truth and in the next breath lied about the size of his election victory. 
He claimed to be the "least anti-semitic person you've ever seen" - then shouted down a Jewish reporter for being "insulting", and asking a question on anti-semitism. 
He insisted repeatedly he had no ties with Putin, but would not give a yes or no answer on whether his campaign team had spoken to Russian officials before the election. 
And he kind of blamed the press for pushing the US closer to a "nuclear holocaust like no other." 
Here's all the most unhinged moments from Donald Trump's baffling press conference 1. He complained the press don't tell the truth President Donald Trump (Photo: Getty) 
Trump started his press conference on the offensive. 
He said he was there to "update the American people on the incredible progress" his administration had made in his first month in office. 
But he complained that "many of our nation's reporters will not tell you the truth." 
Later in the 75 minute press conference, he had a to and fro with CNN reporter Jim Acosta - where he not only dismissed the broadcaster as "fake news" but "very fake news." 
And even the BBC took a beating, with John Sopel being dismissed as "another beauty". He said the Beeb were "just like CNN." 2. ....and then he lied about his election victory 
He'd barely had time to take a breath after attacking the media for not telling the truth, before he told his first blatant lie. 
He said his 306 electoral vote victory was “I guess the biggest electoral win since Ronald Reagan.” 
This is untrue Every president since Ronald Reagan, with the exception of George W Bush, won their elections by a greater margin than Donald Trump. 
Confronted with this falsehood, Trump at first said he had been talking about Republicans. But when he was told of George HW Bush’s 426 vote win, he said: “I was just given that information, I was just - given it, we had a very big margin.” 
What is the electoral college and how does it work? US Presidential election voting system explained 
The reporter asked: “I guess the question is, why should Americans trust you when you accuse the information they receive as being fake when you’re providing information that is not accurate?” 
Trump said: “Well, I was given that information. I was, actually I’ve seen that information around. But it was a very substantial victory, do you agree with that?” 
The exasperated reporter simply replied: “You’re the President.” 3. He claimed drugs are as cheap as candy bars (Photo: REUTERS) 
Trump claimed America was "becoming a drug infested nation." 
He added: "Drugs are becoming cheaper than candy bars". 
He did not provide any evidence for this claim. 4. He claimed to be the "least anti-Semitic person you've ever seen" Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
